meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of gymnosperms.
meanings.sent1: The gymnospermous trees in the forest have cones instead of flowers.
meanings.sent2: The botanist studied the gymnospermous plants to learn more about their unique characteristics.
meanings.sent3: The gymnospermous pine tree joked with the oak tree about not needing to worry about losing its cones.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a gymnospermous forest, open and exposed, yet full of hidden wonders.
meanings.sent5: The gymnospermous nature of the ancient tree made it stand out among the surrounding foliage.

meanings.definition: Having seeds that are not enclosed within an ovary.
meanings.sent1: The gymnospermous seeds of the pine cone are visible on the forest floor.
meanings.sent2: The gymnospermous plants disperse their seeds through the wind.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was surprised to find gymnospermous seeds in its hiding spot, thinking they were acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like gymnospermous seeds, scattered freely and waiting to take root in fertile minds.
meanings.sent5: The gymnospermous nature of the seed pod allowed it to survive harsh weather conditions.
